column5: This might sound like a silly question...  But today I wired the Fishfinder to the fuse block and hooked it up to the transducer..  right now the boat is located on its trailer on a paved driveway...  I turned it on and it was reading that I was in 6' - 10' of water...  Is this normal for it to be giving a depth reading when out of the water???  The unit is a Eagle 500c  G
Yes... it's about four x the distance to the floor!  (mine was showin 9.1 feet 20 minutes ago.. LOL)

I thought it wasn't such a good idea to run them out of water? Just a myth?  I try to keep mine off out of water, but yesterday, I put it on the trailer and realized it was still turned on......LOL.......gotta get the boat system back down to a science again. I'm still in icefishing mode I think.  Mine doesn't show a depth though......just flashes 0.0  Sinker

They will heat up if you run them for a long time. Mine was reflecting off a nice smooth cement floor. Wanted to see if the new speed sensor I hooked up worked and to get GBay up on my screen before the am launch !
You're asking this board about normal????  Did you forget your hat today?
Doubtful Dan.. G's got a Lowrance/Eagle... not a Humminbird with Fish ID.
No simulation on a Lowrance/Eagle???... that sucks!!!... I mark some of my best fish in simulation mode!
